subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|i}} – a position on the forearm where the pulse can be palpated by compressing the [[radial artery]]. It is called {{zh-l|寸口}} in modern Chinese and the meaning of a unit of measurement is derived from the distance between the wrist and this position. Compare {{zh-l|*又}}, {{zh-l|*手}}, {{zh-l|*九}}, {{zh-l|*爪}}.
